title: British Currency Lesson Plan
content:
Understanding British Currency

Lesson Overview

Duration: 45-60 minutes
Level: Intermediate

Learning Objectives

  • Identify and name different British coins and banknotes (1p to £50)
  • Practice asking and answering questions about prices and money
  • Learn vocabulary related to shopping and payment
  • Compare British currency with other currencies

Materials Needed

  • Visual English Book 7, Unit 6 slides
  • Printable British currency worksheets
  • Pictures of British coins and banknotes
  • Sample price tags and shopping items

Lesson Procedure

Step 1: Introduction to British Currency (10 minutes)

Begin with a video on British currency to familiarize students with the coins and notes.

Instructions:

  1. Show the YouTube video "Learn English Money from 1p to 50 Pounds"
  2. Ask students to take notes on the different denominations they see
  3. After the video, review the names and values of the coins and notes

Materials:

  • YouTube Video: British currency explained

Step 2: Currency Recognition Practice (15 minutes)

Students practice identifying different British currency denominations.

Instructions:

  1. Distribute the British currency worksheet
  2. Students work individually to complete the identification exercises
  3. Review answers as a class, addressing any confusion about coin/note values

Materials:

  • British currency worksheet (printable from provided link)
Teacher Note: The printable worksheet is available at the link provided in the additional resources section.

Step 3: Price Inquiry Role Play (15 minutes)

Students practice asking and answering questions about prices in pairs.

Instructions:

  1. Divide students into pairs and assign roles (customer and shop assistant)
  2. Provide price tags for various items
  3. Students take turns asking "How much is this?" and responding with appropriate prices
  4. Extend the activity to include making change and discussing payment methods
Teacher Note: Encourage students to use expressions like "That's £5.99, please" and "Here's your change" to make the interactions more authentic.

Step 4: Interactive Currency Games (15 minutes)

Reinforce learning through online interactive games.

Instructions:

  1. Have students play the Kahoot or Wordwall games about British currency
  2. Students can play individually or in small teams
  3. After the games, discuss any challenging questions or new vocabulary

Materials:

  • Kahoot online game about money
  • Wordwall interactive games (2 options available)

Step 5: Currency Conversion Activity (5 minutes)

Students practice converting between British pounds and their local currency.

Instructions:

  1. Provide current exchange rates between pounds and local currency
  2. Give students a list of prices in pounds and have them convert to local currency
  3. Discuss the concept of exchange rates and how they affect travel and shopping

Assessment

Observe students during the pair work and interactive games to assess their ability to recognize currency denominations and correctly use price-related vocabulary. The Kahoot scores can also provide immediate feedback on understanding.

Homework Ideas

  • Create a shopping list with 10 items and their prices in British pounds
  • Research and write 5 interesting facts about the history of British currency
  • Complete the British currency worksheet if not finished in class

Additional Resources

  • Learn English Money from 1p to 50 Pounds (YouTube Video)
  • British currency worksheet to print
  • KAHOOT ONLINE GAME MONEY
  • ONLINE GAME WORDWALL - Option 1
  • ONLINE GAME WORDWALL - Option 2

metadata.description: A comprehensive 45-60 minute lesson plan for teaching British currency vocabulary and shopping conversations to intermediate ESL students.
